description:
The Lake Laurentian Conservation area consists of 950 hectares (2400 acres) of protected green space just minutes from downtown Sudbury. This trail is an old gravel road with a floating boardwalk in the middle that crossed a large pond and wetland area.  At the end there is moonlight beach with full changeroom facilities.
For more info check out http://www.rainbowroutes.com/index.php/routes/lake-laurentian-conservation-area/
directions: Turn onto Ramsey Lake road at Science north and travel for 2km to the turnoff for South Bay road. Follow South Bay road past the conservation area turn off and continue .5 km untill you get to the parking area at the Boi Ski Chalet
title: LLCA Moonlight Beach Trail
